moves.1. e4:
Hi everyone!

In this game, a king is caught in the centre and that unlucky king's opponent then takes advantage of the situation by using a pawn to smash open some lines onto the uncastled king.  A certain queen hovers around like a vulture and then descends on it.  But whose king ends up in Old Matey's shadow and cannot escape?  Read on and see.
moves.3... exd4 4. Nxd4 Bc5 5. Be3 Qf6: 5. …… Qf6 - there is tension on d4 and Glenda adds to it!
moves.7. Bc4 Ne5 8. Bb3 d6: 8. ….. d6 - now Fou Leblanc has freedom in his sights.  Later on that h3 square will become a very significant landing base.
moves.9. Nd2 Nd3+ 10. Ke2: 10. Ke2 - white is forced to move his king.
moves.10... Nf4+ 11. Kf1 O-O: 11. …..0-0 now my rook is indirectly bearing down on the WK.
moves.12. Qf3 Neg6: 12. …. Neg6 - I want to keep a knight on f4 for as long as possible so Sir Slugabout comes out to g6 to back up Sir Lollabout.
moves.13. Bxf4 Nxf4 14. Ne2 Nxe2 15. Qxe2: 15. Qxe2? - Better I think was Qxf3 followed by Kxg2 making a right mess of my kingside pawns.  As it is my pawn structure is still intact and Glenda is still on the board!
moves.15... Bg4: 15. ….. Bg4 - it looks as though I have blundered a piece but should the WQ take off Fou Leblanc then Glenda will deal instant death to the WK on f2.
moves.16. f3 Rae8 17. Qd3 c6: 17. …… c6 - preparing a possible d5 to try and open up the e file.
moves.18. Bc2 Qh4: 18. ….. Qh4 - again # is threatened on f2!
moves.19. Qe2 Bc8 20. Nb3 Bb6 21. a4 a5: 21. …… a5 - creating a bolt-hole for Fou Lenoir at a7.  I wish to keep him on the a7-g1 diagonal for as long as possible.
moves.22. Nd4: 22. Nd4 - so he shuts off the diagonal with his knight.  However, my f pawn is just about to go berserk!
moves.25. Rxe8 fxg2+: 25. ….. fxg2 DOUBLE CHECK!!!  NOW - That one little pawn has done a lot of damage to white's position.  White can only move his king as it is a double check.  His best move is Kxg2 but he will still go down to a horrible checkmate!
moves.26. Kxg2 Bh3+ 27. Kg1 Qg4+: 27. …… Qg4+ - white waves the white flag as he can only interpose his queen on the next turn.  Glenda will just zap her off and deliver mate on g2.  What a game!  I will soon be writing about another game, carefully compiled by one of my buddies but for now enjoy!  Kind regards - Joanne
